full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 743 Filed 08/10/22 Page 11 of 247 139 LBUCmax1 Visoski - direct 1 Q. Based on your interactions with and observations of Mr. Epstein's employees, where in the hierarchy did Ms. Maxwell fall? 2 A. Ms. Maxwell was number 2. It was definitely Mr. Epstein was a big number 1. 3 4 Q. What makes you say that Ms. Maxwell was the number 2 in your experience? 5 A. She was the one that pretty much handled most of the finance, my expenses, spending in the office. 6 7 Q. What, if any, assistants did Mr. Epstein have, other than Ms. Maxwell? 8 9 A. As far as secretaries or personal assistants, is that what you mean? 10 11 Q. Personal assistants. 12 A. He had an array of personal assistants, almost like professional shoppers, because there was a lot of items that needed to be purchased for all of the properties that were being acquired. So there were several people that were personal assistants. 13 14 Q. How about Ms. Maxwell, did she have personal assistants? 15 A. Yes, I would consider Ms. Maxwell a personal assistant. 16 17 Q. My question was, did Ms. Maxwell have her own personal assistants. 18 A. Oh, I see. Yes, she had assistants, as well. 19 20 Q. What were the names of some of the personal assistants you SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00011783
